title: Arsenal legend Lee Dixon accused of racism over Son Heung-min comment during Liverpool v Tottenham | Metro News
text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 11:08 am Lee Dixon won four league titles and three FA Cup with Arsenal (Getty) 
Lee Dixon has been accused of racism after a comment he made relating to Son Heung-min while commentating on Liverpool’s 2-0 win over Tottenham. 
The Arsenal legend was working for American TV network NBC when South Korea international Son picked up a yellow card for a wild tackle on Liverpool’s Roberto Firmino. 
During a replay of the incident, Dixon said: ‘Haaaiiyaa’, before adding ‘karate kick’. L L how can the commentator say "HAAAIIYAA, karate kick" at Son pic.twitter.com/pkpi79wrHu 
— Tristán (@TheFamousRed) February 11, 2017 
Some people watching the game on NBC were upset with Dixon’s commentary, with a few even calling for the former England international to be sacked from his role with the network. I am appalled and disgusted by this. This might have flown during the alcoholic PL era but no today @LeeDixon2 https://t.co/5On1w3i4Jj
